website_summaries.verdict: Amazing contrast and true-to-life image with an impressively thin screen. Extremely realistic and intense thanks to its intelligent processor.
pros: The a7 Intelligent processor provides a lifelike picture and cinematic experience
AI ThinQ technology with Google Assistant
Uses the latest panels for impeccable black and intense color
cons: Some recommend using external speakers to improve the sound

website_summaries.verdict: Lots of state-of-the-art features in a 55-inch model that will save you a bit of money over one of LG's larger OLED TVs.
pros: Has a versatile 55-inch size along with amazing image quality
a7 processor helps bring action to life
Can be controlled with Alexa through the brand's magic remote
Offers easy access to numerous apps
cons: Sound isn't as good as some others in its class, but adding a soundbar or additional speakers will help
Setting it up requires some tech savvy

customer_reviews.title: it works fine, great quality picture and it has the same ...
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was quick arriving on the first day of the shipping window rather than the last. Be careful and beware of the fact that not all 2018 models are alike. The model OLED 55B8PUA has the older A7 processor while the OLED C8PUA has the new A9 processor and the price of the C8 model is typically $200 more. That said, I bought the B8 (my mistake): however, it works fine, great quality picture and it has the same features that 99% of viewers would not see any difference between the B8 and the C8. So in the end I am satisfied with the B8 and saved myself $200.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Lesson learned--don't buy major appliances online
customer_reviews.text: A little over a month after installing our new LG OLED tv, there is a one inch horizontal band at the bottom of the screen than flashes and goes in and out of focus constantly. Called the Amazon help and after 40 minutes on the phone, I was literally told, after some basic questions as to when the band is visible (all the time), to read the owners manual for resetting the TV. I reset the TV. Band still there. Hoping to get help from LG on this problem. Until then, I would recommend to those thinking of buying an expensive TV online, don't. It is a hassle to get the support you need when something goes wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Boyet

customer_reviews.title: Best TV ever made.
customer_reviews.text: Buy this TV now, no regrets. No other TV I’ve ever seen can hold even a birthday cake candle to this masterwork of technology. LG appears to have more or less resolved the majority of issues that have affected past generations of OLED panels, such as image burn-in risk, and stuttering/shimmering when viewing low framerate content (ie, most TV and movies we watch). I can say without reservation that LG has finally made OLED a fully viable, no compromise technology.
customer_reviews.author: blondvillain

customer_reviews.title: Great picture!
customer_reviews.text: Took quite a bit of effort to get this tv set up to my liking! At first - the remote was not responsive, but a phone call told me to 'shake it' and then click. Not sure why shaking was necessary - but, hey, it worked. The picture setting choices were all too dark for my taste, so had to pick the brightest one. Eventually, I stumbled over the controls for adjusting brightness and contrast. Almost perfect... then stumbled over an energy saving button. Turned that OFF, and now pictue is perfect! As usual - the manual leaves a lot to be desired - no listing of the menus or all the choices. But, I love the TV.
customer_reviews.author: R. Coughlin

customer_reviews.title: Zero Allowance for Privacy
customer_reviews.text: The hardware is a marvel, and the picture is fantastic. And this is also a platform for LG to track you and push ads to you. Perhaps I am naive to expect just a television today, but please be warned that you are giving them far more than the cash to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Horrible audio lag
customer_reviews.text: See title. After an hour or so, terrible audio lag. Cutting the tv off and on resets it but it returns after an hour. The audio sync option doesn't fix it. Every combination of options under audio doesnt fix it. You can't set a fixed delay under options because the lag is variable. As I said 0 on startup and progressively worse as time goes on. Simply unbelievable that a set that costs this much would have this issue. I just bought it 2 days ago and it is updated to the most recent firmware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Every time I sit down and turn on the TV I'm blown away by how wonderful the picture is. Even silly shows on the CW look great. Watch a movie like Dunkirk- and it is like being there. The picture and the fact that the screen is SO thin- and the base is not that much bigger makes this TV hard to beat. I highly recommend this TV. I won't go back from OLED.
customer_reviews.author: HBG

customer_reviews.title: Terrible picture quality for near-black scenes
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy the LG B8. It has terrible near-black artefacts, which means near-black scenes look terrible. LG tried to fix that with an update, but the improvement is marginal. For such an expensive TV this is unacceptable, you get a terrible image for dark scenes, Game of Thrones is impossible to watch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great except when it didn't.
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful TV when it worked. We had a strange problem: certain channels would not play back video unless we unplugged and replugged the HDMI cable. That worked fine, but you don't want to pay this much for a new TV and be dealing with it like a 30 year old piece of test equipment. Apparently the problem is with the version of HDCP used by some channels, but not others. LG couldn't figure it out, so we sent it back and are currently waiting for a refund from Amazon. Sending a TV back is a PAIN.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Best picture, best contrast out there
customer_reviews.text: I've got champagne tastes on a beer budget. Bought one of these primo OLED displays on a second hand, brand new site. The tv arrived within a week, no shipping charge, Fedex ground, not my favorite shipping company, but no problems. Worth the money, if you watch a lot of tv, especially movies, and can swing the dollars, do it.
customer_reviews.author: Morejam

customer_reviews.title: Stuck pixel within 4 months, poor service
customer_reviews.text: Stuck pixel within 4 months of using. Amazon service of no help as they only "help" within the first month. They punt you to LG customer service who is also unhelpful. Multiple phone calls and two weeks into trying to get this brand new TV working properly and I'm still waiting. Very disappointing how both Amazon and the manufacturer pass the buck when it comes to repairing a faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Really cool and excellent picture quality
customer_reviews.text: The fact that it's almost invisible from its side view in its being so thin and the picture quality despite its size is great. Great value, since similarly sized tvs are much more expensive, over a thousand dollars more (I think, although I'm not a price comparing fiend). The menu structure and the remote control layout is very intuitive. Very solid product. Very light despite its huge picture size, since it's so thin. Not weak in strength though, since I have it wall mounted and I pull and push on it all the time to adjust the viewing angle.
customer_reviews.author: Baltimore MacCallister

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: The only reasons I haven't rated this 5 stars is because: 1. I haven't mastered all the options yet. I am still working through the layers. 2. Only have had it for a month, so can't say anything about durability. It arrived, as scheduled, worked right out of the box and has a great picture quality. Connected to the Wi-Fi easily. My wife is happy.
customer_reviews.author: dustdevil

customer_reviews.title: TV dead out of box
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was pristine. TV looks perfect out of the box. Got TV set up, hit power button, brief flash of a few lines, then TV shuts right back off. LG tech support was awful. Was previously happy with my old LG/Zenith products, would never buy another product from them again. Wouldn't buy from this seller ever again either.
customer_reviews.author: Squire

customer_reviews.title: Pleased as punch
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a 50” 2012 Panasonic plasma that was great. But the difference is night and daaaaaang. It’s so thin, it’s mind blowing. I’m perpetually blown away by the picture on this display. It’s eveything I hoped it would be and more. Bonus: my wife loves it too. It makes movie night into an experience. The images are so lifelike and vibrant, I find myself in awe of it. Worth the money. You’re buying the best picture money can buy. I just wish there was more 4K content available to watch.
customer_reviews.author: M. Golad

customer_reviews.title: Don't touch it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on Jan/19. 7 months later: 1) Got black line cross the screen 2) TV just turn off every few minutes! 3) Remote control disconnect from TV all the time Amazing that for 2400$ TV we have such problems!!!!! One good note: Service came and replaced half of the TV. Working for now.
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel

customer_reviews.title: Stunning picture that cant be beat.
customer_reviews.text: It was a tough decision to spend over 2K on a tv- but once the price dropped sub 1800, there was really no competition in the market. Picture color, perfect blacks, and viewing angles make this the perfect tv for my living room space. Menus and navigation are intuitive and set up was very reasonable. Make sure you have a friend to help pick up the tv, especially with the 65, it is a bit too much without the extra set of hands.
customer_reviews.author: David McConnell

customer_reviews.title: Great OLED TV at a decent price!
customer_reviews.text: This TV has been a great upgrade from my 6 year old LG LED TV. Do your research and find what serves your purpose best, for done it will be QLED - if you watch sports or your viewing room doesn’t darken easily. OLED is fantastic for cinematic movies with dark scenes, and your viewing room should be able to be darkened. This OLED is not the highest end of the OLEDs out there, there is the LG C8 series, but the price is a lot higher and the benefit is minimal. This tv is a lot of quality at a pretty awesome price point.
customer_reviews.author: Cary

customer_reviews.title: Apps are terrible and No Apple TV Support
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this TV or any LG TV because the WebOS software is terrible and they are not going to offer Apple TV Support. The picture is good, but it is NO different than any other high end TV out there. So you may as well buy one with a great interface as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alessia Baccarini

customer_reviews.title: LG, worst customer service
customer_reviews.text: I brought a 2018 65 inch OLED TV almost a year to the day when it stopped working. As I am writing this review I am on hold with customer service for 31 minutes. It is Wednesday and I have to wait until next Monday for a tech to come out. He will look at TV and see what part it needs, order the part and when it comes in they will call to schedule and appointment to install part. I have a stainless steel oven, microwave, dishwasher and refrigerator from LG. First time needing customer service and they act like they could care less, very disappointed with LG. I will never buy LG again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Conklin

customer_reviews.title: “Big” Mistake
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying the latest greatest, but was amazed at how poor the picture quality was. I have a 13-year-old plasma HDTV that has a much better picture. I also could not sync the TV with my sound bar, or my Xfinity remote, to get complete functions I had to use three different remotes. Needless to say I boxed it up container that’s almost as big as a twin bed and shipped it back to Amazon the same day I got it...thank goodness for free shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Best Value for a TV - Top Quality and Great Picture
customer_reviews.text: This TV is a top line TV at a bargain of a price. Comparable to all other top line TVs without the same cost the picture quality makes you feel like you are in the scene. With many different brightness options based on what you are watching you will always be able to see your show the way you want. You can even see the Battle Scene in Game of Thrones! Who knew it was not just a dark screen!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Purdy

customer_reviews.title: Just WOW
customer_reviews.text: Everything I've heard about oled is true. The black levels are unreal! The colors in HDR content are unbelievable. I recall the first time I saw an HD picture, and this was a similar experience. I had concerns about the price and the dreaded burn-in, but right now, I think it's worth the possible gamble. I was torn between a 75" qled and this 65" oled. I'm glad I went with picture quality over quantity. Time will tell if oled can last me as long as my trusty LEDs have.
customer_reviews.author: Total Geek

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture quality; Easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: We are amazed every day by the picture quality. It brings shows and films to life: it seems like live feeds. Installation was easy, since we used the available service. DISH network sent two service people to put this up on the wall mount, including hiding the wiring. The controller was the smarted self-setup I've ever used. It even works with AT&T U-verse set top box.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Newell

customer_reviews.title: The OLED screen is great!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a Samsung 4K UHD which had thin, washed-out colors. The LG OLED has a wonderful picture with saturated colors - about as good as my late, lamented Panasonic plasma TV. Mastering the remote takes time but I am getting what I want.
customer_reviews.author: drcantley

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for anyone looking for a TV.
customer_reviews.text: Sound and picture quality are excellent. We hooked up the Fire TV Cube and it works great to switch from Amazon Prime to Netflix to Plex. Love the easy use. It's a perfect size for our living room. Highly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler - VA

customer_reviews.title: These OLED's will change what you think about tv.
customer_reviews.text: When you properly configure the HDR from external sources (a setting in the tv) this thing blows your mind. Every one I have shown this tv to shares a great degree of being impressed. Once you see OLED, you see the benefits of nearly infinite contrast while the brights next to dark's really look great. It changes the quality of the image, even in SDR content. The framerate interpolation with the built in apps is also very impressive, and is so realistic it's almost eerie, as if it's happening in your house and you're just looking through some kind of reality window. Fantastic, would recommend whole heartedly.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing TV
customer_reviews.text: Meets my needs, I mainly watch shows and movies so the 4k at 60hz is plenty enough for me. I could see this being an issue for those who want to play fast paced games at the highest refresh rate, chances are you'll play on a smaller monitor as it is. There is a vast application package, so there should never be a shortage of content to watch. My one and only gripe is the remote, the power button seems almost impossible to press sometimes. The button layout is annoying to me as well, this is merely my opinion though, a simple download to make my phone the remote fixed this issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: OLED lives up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: Visuals look stunning when used with my Xbox One X, 4K content on Youtube and Netflix really showcase how great the picture quality is on this TV! The blacks are perfect! The thinness of the tv makes it a statement piece for anyone's living room. The sound system was better than anticipated, but sound bar is optimal.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Tips for a new TV
customer_reviews.text: Setting up this TV for your smart home can get frustrating. Make sure you use the same email you used for your smart home when registering the TV set and LG, and both LG skills on Alexa. Also don't be surprised by the terrible appearance of the screen at first. You have to disable the energy save feature. After that it's all good. TV looks great and works well.
customer_reviews.author: The DL

customer_reviews.title: Excellent picture
customer_reviews.text: Great picture. Mediocre sound, but that's to be expected. They should start making TV's with sound bar included. Setup is fairly easy, though pairing with Alexa was a chore.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: OLED a must for serious TV people
customer_reviews.text: Was a little hesitant to splurge for an OLED but glad I did. The deep black and infinite contrast really do set it apart from LED 4k sets. Saved $200 by getting the 2018 model in 2019 which helped. This is our first smart TV and it's great to get rid of the Chromecast and Fire Stick dongles. My only (minor) complaint is that the glare is very noticeable. A home theater room would be no problem but we are planning to change the lighting in our living room to reduce glare for prime viewing angles.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Not prepared for the fantastic size
customer_reviews.text: compared to our old 32" tv, but, oh my! LOVE IT. Beautiful picture, great sound, NO complaints after 1 month of enjoying this fabulous television.
customer_reviews.author: Trish the Dish

customer_reviews.title: Got off to a rough start...
customer_reviews.text: I received the TV, assembled the stand, packed away the old set, fired up the new set and...nothing. After calling tech support and walking through everything, it was determined the TV was defective and needed to be returned. Disaasembled, repacked, UPS picked it up and a couple days later the new set arrived and all went well. This is an incredible TV. I needed high viewing angles due to the room configuration and with no plasma sets available, the OLED was the only option. Cannot speak highly enough about the LG OLED. Nothing else compares.
customer_reviews.author: KLKat

customer_reviews.title: Best TV on the market.  No brainer at sub $1000 price.
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd LG OLED B8 TV. WebOS is one of the best smart TV systems out there combined with the unbeatable OLED picture quality. Once you have a OLED, it is hard to go back to normal TVs with their greyish "blacks". Love the pointer remote, but wish it had a querty keyboard for account entry. WebOS has a ton of free channels included that may be sufficient for some cable cutters that have Netflix/Amazon. Mainly use Youtube TV with this and it has a built in app to avoid having to use a 2nd box/stick.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: 2 month old tv, problem!
customer_reviews.text: bought tv through amazon, 2 months later, what appears to be " A Pixel" has gone bad! white dot in screen! not dirt!
customer_reviews.author: gene capangan

customer_reviews.title: Life's Good!
customer_reviews.text: To begin with we have other LG products [refrigerator and stove] and love them. All are excellent products. The 55' OLED we purchased right out of the box had deep excellent colors [reminds me of our Plasma we've had over 10 years], was easy to set up. So far very satisfied and would recommend this product especially with the price dropping to anyone looking to upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Donuthin

customer_reviews.title: Its a TV
customer_reviews.text: Expensive a.. TV but I love it. Bought it for 4k gaming and looks awesome...Remote is defenetly big upgrade from 5 year old magic remote I have. Also note compared to 5 year old lg TV (don't know about other brands) the interface is exceptionally quick
customer_reviews.author: Alex K.

customer_reviews.title: No instructions on how to use smart features.
customer_reviews.text: Once adjusted This TV has a great picture and mediocre sound quality. However, this is a smart TV and what it's not included are any directions on how to use the smart features. I sent an email to the company asking for asking for an instruction book on the smart features and how to use them and received no response. What good is a smart TV if there are no instructions on how to use the smart features
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Crazy nice TV
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad i upgraded my TV. Really nice .. My games also. I do a lot of Zwifting in 4k..The sound blows me away. I'm hard of hearing but with this new Clear Voice III I have no problem.
customer_reviews.author: rungel

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure why people pay so much for these types of TVs. The picture is unimpressive. Husband asked for it specifically, otherwise I’d have preferred a bigger TV for a third of the price. Whatareyagonnado?
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great to tv
customer_reviews.text: I had a ka8000 before this one going to mess it not going to miss Samsung’s customer service though but So far it’s a great tv my only concern is going to be burn in but I’m hoping for the best with that Other than that it’s been a great TV
customer_reviews.author: R.Porter

customer_reviews.title: Love It, Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I went into Costco the LG picture would make me stop and watch that t.v. So I decided to take the plunge. So happy I did. The picture is beyond amazing and now I am watching travel and National Geographic to appreciate the clarity and color of the picture. Glad I made the plunge. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Ort

customer_reviews.title: So good, I had a party to celebrate it
customer_reviews.text: Hadn't gotten a new TV in more than a decade. Wow, they've gotten so much better! Glad I waited, and this was the TV worth waiting for. Picture quality is amazing, and the onscreen menus and apps are super convenient and easy to use. And really love using the remote to do text to speech on all the input boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Nox Helios

customer_reviews.title: Amazing TV!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great TV, the picture is amazing and there is less worry of burn-in as it will go to a screen saver like mode. My one complaint is with the integration with the sound bar there is no number associated with the volume so you don't know how loud it is. Google assistant integration could also use some work.
customer_reviews.author: MSwale

customer_reviews.title: Noice
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to upgrade TVs in the next few years, so I bought an OLED TV. The reviews are all true, the picture quality is amazing. I'll be enjoying this for quite some time. As others mention in their reviews, the TV isn't as bright as normal LED TVs, so keep that in mind. That only really matters during the day if your watching area is very sunny.
customer_reviews.author: Wrecked Angles

customer_reviews.title: what a great t.v.!
customer_reviews.text: This arrived as expected and in excellent packed condition even though we had originally requested an earlier delivery time to try to get it set up before the first college game of the season! It is an incredibly thin screen, about the size of the cardboard used to support it in the original box. Easy to set up and what an AWESOME picture! (and not so bad to not get set up in time as the team that was rooted for lost anyway! :))
customer_reviews.author: J Jones

customer_reviews.title: This television is fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: I had the same television for the last dozen or so years and I really liked my old Sharp Aquas it was a great TV, but I was not prepared for the eye candy that this television delivered. I knew it looked good in the store, but it looks good if not better in my bedroom. The picture is eye melting, the sound is outstanding for regular TV speakers and the menus are super easy to navigate. I love this television.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: great product and stil can register for a 1yr warranty
customer_reviews.text: great product i couldn't resist the price for this oled to be 1011$ was a little on edge but my package came a day early, well boxed and undamaged. picture quality is excellent and setup is very easy. surprisingly much lighter than my led 55. only this missing was the back of my remote? Also was able to buy an extended warranty for my tv up 3 extra years
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: So happy with my first purchase I ordered a second unit for my vacation home. Highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Simply stunning!
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible tv. The picture is truly stunning. Ante up the extra money for this model over non-OLED units, but also get this model while you can. The 2019 models are not worth upgrading from this. Get it! Be very carefully when unboxing. Read the directions. I’m sure the tv screen itself is somewhat sturdy and able to withstand some initial install abuse, but man this thing is THIN. 75% of the screen is literally 1/4” thick. Be careful!
customer_reviews.author: Bloomberg10

customer_reviews.title: Picture Seems just as good as the newer C9
customer_reviews.text: Perfect in every way. Bright, even in my bright family room. WebOS is the way all smart TVs need to be. Super sharp, super contrast, deep blacks, great at all viewing angles. TV WiFi was slow until I updated the software, now it’s blazing fast.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Alpert

customer_reviews.title: Great TV!
customer_reviews.text: Went from 1080P sony to this bad boy. By far the best quality I've ever seen. 4k movies are crystal clear and gaming on my Xbox X is way more enjoyable than ever!
customer_reviews.author: omerta

customer_reviews.title: Thinnest, and best TV I have owed
customer_reviews.text: I get compliments all the time, and everyone is so, so surprised when they see how thin this TV is. No one wants to be too close as they think it will break. The colors, night and day have been perfect. Not one thing to complain about. We weighed the newer version of this LG TV, to this one we purchased. There was not anything showing they had newer and better features so we saved the money and got this one. No regrets, perfect TV.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: excellent state-of-the art best picture quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the TV you want. O-LED is not to be confused with Q-led which is the last decade of low quality. OLED stands for organic light emitting diode, light-emitting pixels, which amounts to a completely different technology than the LED/LCD of the late-90s' market continuing through 2017, give or take a few years. This was a gift and would have gone up to the 65 but the console was for a 55-er. It's a thin as a slice of bread.
customer_reviews.author: Light Nykorchuk

customer_reviews.title: Listen to it before you purchase it
customer_reviews.text: Picture is awesome, Sound is bad,can't understand words at low volume . My Samsung is much clearer. Working on trying a speaker system
customer_reviews.author: Rumbley

customer_reviews.title: Best tv for the price ever!
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing tv picture. My wife said it is crazy beautiful. Easy set up and wi fi connection. Remote takes a little getting used to but repetition is a great teacher. Perfect size for our family room. This is my second LG tv. The last one lasted over 7 yrs. I am one happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Icthus

customer_reviews.title: I'll never go back from OLED
customer_reviews.text: The alb is annoying at times, but always adjusts properly after a moment. After optimizing settings, I removed all black crush. Input lag is great considering it's OLED. With of panel is surprising, thinner than my S10. Picture quality is phenomenal, both HDR and Dolby vision picture modes switch seamlessly. Quality image. Speakers could be better, but so could all TV speakers. Dolby atmos passthrough support makes it not matter. True cinephiles will want OLED. I'll never go back.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M

customer_reviews.title: Best TV's on the market!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd OLED I've purchased this year...have the 65" C8 and now the 55" B8 (due to lightning killing my old Plasma). Love the OLED's and will never go back. The only difference between the 2 is the processor, and I can only notice a difference when scrolling through the menu on the B8...lags a bit in comparison to the C8 but not enough to bother me. GREAT TV!
customer_reviews.author: PSU-Temple

customer_reviews.title: Great picture,but difficult to determine proper settings
customer_reviews.text: There are no instructions that come with the set on how to determine the proper settings for sound and picture. I had to search the internet. Also there is no factory default setting to make this any easier. Other than that the picture is outstanding. Using the remote control to manipulate the settings is a learn by doing it challenge.
customer_reviews.author: marty

customer_reviews.title: The best picture
customer_reviews.text: The picture on this tv is unreal. I put in a lot of review time before going with this tv for my dad and it handles anything you can throw at it. The internal cpu is fast but we put a fire stick on it so we didn't really care about the smartness of the tv.
customer_reviews.author: zac

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound
customer_reviews.text: The picture is great but I have to adjust sound level all the time. Is there any trick to it? Overall, I like this TV.
customer_reviews.author: angelaand

customer_reviews.title: Great tv but streaming can be an issue
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful screen. I hate the remote. Be advised that you need minimum of 25 mbps streaming from your router otherwise you won’t be able to stream. Instructions say router need to be 3 feet away which is ridiculous. Tech support was very helpful. We had to do some trouble shooting to get the WiFi to work. Tech support admitted this is a known issue. WiFi should be better for such an expensive tv
customer_reviews.author: JJ SF

customer_reviews.title: Perfect picture quality but no apple air play
customer_reviews.text: Perfect picture! After watching an OLED Tv at a friend’s apartment, I’ve decided to get one. Unfortunately, LG will not release Apple Air Play 2 functionality on this model, which I was looking forward to
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture quality
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our 42 inch tv in our bedroom with this masterpiece. This is by far the most amazing tv I have ever owned. The picture quality is perfect the audio is great for our bedroom. I think it would require a sound bar if it were in a larger room but most televisions do. We love absolutely everything about the tv and it is worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: David h

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Customer Service and Product
customer_reviews.text: The TV arrived a day early. I have been researching various LED TVs and decided on this model for various reasons . The OLED TVs work best in darker environments. Even thou mine isn't the darkest environment I am pleased with my chose. If your room isn't on the darker side you may like the QLED sets better. you may also want to google: OLED vs QLed .
customer_reviews.author: James C. Berryman

customer_reviews.title: This is the best TV ive owned.
customer_reviews.text: Searched, reviewed and searched some more. Finally decided on this TV. And its possibly one of the best purchases ive made. The contrast, quality and general functionalities make this an amazing TV. Its so ridiculously skinny that it will make you worry wvery time you move it but youll figure out how to manover from the bottom. I have it mounted so i cant speak to the the stand but if you looking for a TV and want the best quality. Stop looking you found it.
customer_reviews.author: Procurement Specialist!

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but the best
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture. Little complicated to set up. Thanks YouTube videos. If you can spend the money you won’t find a better picture.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: It feels like I have a home theater now!
customer_reviews.text: The picture and sound are awesome, but it takes a little practice to use the smart features. It took a little work to make it earthquake proof, and to position it to prevent back lighting from windows and lights. Be careful with any smart device not to get sucked into buying services, and many things you really don't need. My only regret is that I waited so long to upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Sirronald

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous picture. Stunning
customer_reviews.text: Don’t use the voice recognition. I wanted a tv without all the smart features but couldn’t find one easily. What is nice about this tv is that my wife can hit the Netflix or amazon button and go straight to that.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rand

customer_reviews.title: Great picture
customer_reviews.text: Great picture, much better than my former LED tv of the same size. The richness of the picture reminds me of my plasma tv that was replaced by the LED because of a lightning strike.
customer_reviews.author: vanshumwa

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: This thing has AMAZING picture. Compare to my previous LED Visio - it's night and day. I did follow rtings website guide to fine-tune the colors. /tv/reviews/lg/b8-oled/settings
customer_reviews.author: viktor

customer_reviews.title: As gorgeous as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful picture. Except for our satellite service's set top box remote, it is not difficult to set up (DVD player etc.) until you get to more advanced features. Haven't set up voice recognition and may not due to privacy concerns but did pair an old Logitech Revue keyboard for internet searches using a new Logitech unifying USB receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Canyonjo

customer_reviews.title: Premium Quality Except for the Remote
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the TV for a week so I cannot speak to longevity. The TV so far is excellent overall and I would give it 4.5 stars if I could. My only complaint is the remote is very cheap for the money spent on this premium TV. Due to its ergonomics it constantly falls of the arm of the chair because it does not sit flat and tends to rock. It does not have any backlight to illuminate the buttons in the dark. Lastly as someone else mentioned it is very creaky when pressing the buttons alluding to its cheap construction.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: A Nice set!
customer_reviews.text: A really nice tv...and a big step up from an older lcd set. The screen had a defect but a new “panel” was sent quickly and repair service was provided.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent black level and picture brightness
customer_reviews.text: Love the black levels, and streaming with the tv, in addition to getting such a great picture, is easy as pie. The tv will do everything I need. It is light, very easy to set up, and a pleasure to watch. The speakers on the tv work really well for tv speakers. I think this was a wise choice for me.
customer_reviews.author: The G Man

customer_reviews.title: Mild disclaimer
customer_reviews.text: Understand that the five stars may be a little misleading. I had a 12 year old 40" Samsung before the LG... to go from that (which was a very nice TV) to an OLED Smart TV at 55" may have something to do with the enthusiasm for the new TV. That said, I'm very please and excited by the LG on all levels.
customer_reviews.author: Siegfried Idle

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: My old TV, well it wasn't old but got hit by lightning so I went with this one and glad I did, the color is so much better and the picture is unbelievable didn't realize my other TV was so out of date even though it wasn't, love the choice I made and I'm one that buy by the reviews so trust me this one is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This TV arrived Well Packaged, and Undamaged . I took it out of the Box and set it up . Everything Worked as Advertised . The TV has Great Color and Sound . TV has Very Hi Detail of Programs, and Images . If you enjoy Quality Pictures and Color than this is the TV to get.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Churchwell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase-exactly what we Needed!
customer_reviews.text: This TV is beautiful and the price was perfect. My friend helped me do a ton of research and because I'm not a gamer and didn't need the C9 features, the B8 was exactly what I needed! Highly recommend getting the mounting dream low profile TV mount to go with this. be advised this TV is as thin as advertised so make sure it's up high enough that your toddler can't get to it!
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Marie Bonillas

customer_reviews.title: Superior product and razor thin.
customer_reviews.text: I can see why consumer reports rated this model so high. It’s clearer than real life. Be sure to wirelessly connect and update the software before attempting to adjust picture parameters. LGs tech support was easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kent

customer_reviews.title: buy it! its worth it! pair it w/ new bluray player
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Amazing picture, surprisingly good audio but I'm using a sound bar, easy and clever screen set up and smart interaction. I paired it with a new sony bluray player for $220 with hi quality cables...This TV oozes quality and worth more to me than 3X the price! A cheap investment...cost divided by hours of enjoyment is a bargain!!
customer_reviews.author: Anton Chigurh

customer_reviews.title: Great TV at Great price but issues right after the end of the year
customer_reviews.text: Edit 26-Aug: Optical output stopped working right after 1 year. Tried different optical cable but to no avail. Hope someone from LG reads this and helps. My first 4k TV. I loved my previous 55' samsung but it stopped working with lcd panel giving away. I just love my new oled. Do change the picture mode from default to Cinema and you should see a huge improvement in pictures that are not 4k quality. Love the build in google assistant though I am still getting used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Dev Girdhar

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: The most beautiful picture you can imagine. Easy to set up. We have not figured out how to use all the features on the remote control yet because we can't quit watching the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stunning TV but not as smart
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture and excellent sound! Only nit pick is that the LG App Store lacks a lot of basic streaming apps (HBO, Apple TV etc). We have to use a fire stick to use a lot of the unavailable apps which is a little annoying in a smart TV this expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Amazing picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture quality, some infrequent pauses in playback using the apps which could use an update.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: I Was On The Fence - But If You Are A Game or Movie Nerd This Is A Must
customer_reviews.text: 4K Dolby Cinema on a professional calibration in a dark room - literally the best picture quality I have ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You can make it as bright as an LED TV
customer_reviews.text: For an OLED tv that is not top of the line you can make it as bright as an LED tv. Dark scenes in movies and games are displayed very clear. I could be happier with my purchase. The remote is okay. It does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: TV is great. Easy set up. Fantastic picture. Lots of extra features. Buttons for Netflix and Amazon on remote makes access to those channels easy. Sound on TV isn’t too bad but will add a sound bar anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Image Quality
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Picture, the 4k demo videos will actually make you have motion sickness.
customer_reviews.author: Bionic Man

customer_reviews.title: Best Looking TV ever
customer_reviews.text: Love this big ole screen. UHD/Dolby Vision. Just the best. I'm upgrading from my LG 55" OLED and simply can't be happier. That set was the best TV I've ever owned and this one is simply that on a bigger screen. Very Very Happy.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W

customer_reviews.title: Great tv
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Awesome picture. You will need a sound bar to project as speakers are under tv & face down. Won’t be a problem for a bedroom but our big living room makes it harder to hear. Have to turn volume up very high
customer_reviews.author: Rob & Des

customer_reviews.title: Looks great
customer_reviews.text: Great TV, I wish the os was built off of android because web os has limited selection of apps, there is no Twitch app. It has really good response time for gaming though compared to many other TVs.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Wallflower

customer_reviews.title: Great picture!
customer_reviews.text: TV is awesome! The menu system seems intuitive and easy to use. Picture quality is great. Dark scenes are sometimes hard to see with all the lights on in the room, but that is rare and not often (and easily fixed when the lights are turned off ;)). More expensive than I wanted to spend, but glad i did.
customer_reviews.author: Brady Velikonia

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product and great service after the purchase
customer_reviews.text: The TV works great. Fantastic color quality and features. I would like to mention VANNS. When I received my originally purchased TV it had been damaged in shipment. When I notified VANNS their folks immediately took care of me and sent a new TV. They were great to work with and I would not hesitate to purchase other electronic products from them.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: The best TV on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I have a plazma TV and although its operation was very good the quality of the LG OLED TV was outstanding and I am very satisfied with the picture quality and ease of operation.
customer_reviews.author: john caton

customer_reviews.title: Not intended for use as a computer monitor
customer_reviews.text: I read and viewed a million reviews on this set and no one ever said this should not be used as a computer monitor until I saw a Phillips TV exec on-line say that OLED sets are not suited for static image viewing. By the time I read that I'd already found that out for myself. The constant dimming and brightening of static images to protect against burn-in will possible drive you as crazy as it did me. Spectacular picture quality but OLED should not be used for static image viewing.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Faloon

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Picture
customer_reviews.text: A beautiful picture. I own two of these sets and I’m impressed every time I watch anything. 4K Amazon shows are beautiful and all other shows have upscaled quality pictures. Smart features and magic remote are also pluses.
customer_reviews.author: David Capps

customer_reviews.title: This is how all Amazon related acquisitions/transactions should be.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived as described and securely packaged. Stunning color and room presence. Very pleased and highly recommended. Would repeat this experience.
customer_reviews.author: thom hendrick

customer_reviews.title: OLED is the new standard
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and secure, packaging. Fast service. Well conceived onboard WEBOS
customer_reviews.author: Hank

product_meta.title: LG Electronics OLED55B8PUA 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart OLED TV (2018 Model)
product_meta.description:
Size:55-Inch| Style:TV

The sleek B8 is designed to elevate a room’s aesthetics while complementing any décor. This new LG OLED TV with AI (Artificial Intelligence) ThinQ has the Google Assistant built in, so it becomes the center for the smart home. Using Intelligent Voice control, simply speak into the LG Magic Remote to search for shows you’re looking for, change TV settings, switch to different inputs and more. And with the Google Assistant, you can ask it to pull up family photos, control light settings, check the weather and more. Plus it works with Amazon Alexa devices. Movies, sports and games come to thrilling new life, more immersive with the perfect black and intense color made possible by LG OLED display technology. The α7 (Alpha7) Intelligent Processor works with the self illuminating pixels to provide true to life images with accurate color plus outstanding depth and sharpness. The B8 features comprehensive support of major 4K high dynamic range formats including premium Dolby Vision, as well as HDR10 and HLG.

*Service limited to certain languages. Some features require 3rd party service subscription. Google Home and Amazon Alexa devices sold separately.
*Dolby Vision is a trademark of Dolby Laboratories.
*Dolby, Dolby Atmos and the double D symbol are registered trademarks of Dolby Laboratories.

The power consumption in standby mode is less than 0.5 watts and the power consumption is 40 watts. Ultra Luminance: Yes.
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes One LG Electronics OLED65B8PUA 65-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart OLED TV, 2018 Model
TV dimensions: Without stand- 57.0" W x 32.7" H x 1.8" D. With Stand- 57.0" W x 34.5" H x 8.7" D. Weight without stand: 46.3 lbs. Screen size: 64.5” Diagonal
Inputs: 4 HDMI, 3 USB, 1 RF, 1 Composite in, 1 Ethernet, 1 Optical, 1 RS232C (Mini Jack) and Audio Return Channel Support via HDMI

LG OLED TV with AI (Artificial Intelligence) ThinQ has the Google Assistant built in, so you can control compatible smart home devices using just your voice through the LG Magic Remote. Create a center for your smart home and beyond. Plus it works with Amazon Alexa devices (sold separately). Not compatible with Roku or Apple devices

LG OLED Display uses the latest panels, with brighter, self illuminating pixels that deliver perfect black and intense color. LG OLED TV with AI ThinQ brings movies, sports, games and more to thrilling new life

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars443 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
